article.headline: Airline stocks surge as President Trump boosts hopes for new stimulus
article.body: Shares of airline companies jumped in premarket trading Wednesday, after President Trump said he would immediately sign individual stimulus measures sent to him, including $25 billion in airline payroll support. Among the most active airline stocks ahead of the open, American Airlines Group Inc. AAL, +0.34% rallied 4.0%, United Airlines Holdings Inc. UAL, +0.32% climbed 4.6%, Delta Air Lines Inc. DAL, +0.39% hiked up 3.5%, Spirit Airlines Inc. SAVE, +1.35% rose 4.1% and Southwest Airlines Co. LUV, +1.89% gained 2.5%. Shares of JetBlue Airways Corp. JBLU, -0.07% ran up 6.0%, as they got a further boost from a double upgrade from J.P. Morgan, as analyst Jamie Baker swung to an overweight rating from underweight, saying "risk/reward if favorable at current valuation levels." The U.S. Global Jets ETF JETS, +0.16%, which advanced 2.5% in the premarket, has tumbled 45.5% year to date through Tuesday, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% has gained 4.0%.
